snippet: With its mishmash of architectural periods, streets packed with colorful shops and Edgar Allan Poe’s clapboard cottage, the neighborhood has a little of everything.
abstract: Sarah Harrison Smith Local Stop column on area around Fordham Road in the Bronx, which is a study in contrasts; neighborhood features elegant 1920s buildings on the Grand Concourse, chain stores on East Fordham Road, Edgar Allan Poe's tiny cottage and the impressive Fordham campus.
lead_paragraph: With its mishmash of architectural periods, streets packed with colorful shops and Edgar Allan Poe’s clapboard cottage, the neighborhood has a little of everything.

headline.print_headline: From Poe to Paradise in the Bronx
headline.seo: Fordham Road, Near the University, Is a Study in Contrasts
